The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.

str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Genitive case of an indefinite pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place, somewhere, i.e. Nearly.

str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.

str2: To make blind, physically or mentally. From tuphlos; to make blind, i.e. to obscure.
